page.title: 10EDUCATION
page.content: Boycott Farm First School was opened in January 1969 to serve the five to nine year olds living on the estate. Seventeen children were admitted on the first day and in two years the school population had risen to 292. Over the next six years, up to 1977, the school roll reached its maximum of 491, occupying 16 classrooms in the building. Since 1977, the 5 to 9 year old population on the estate has declined and the school roll has dropped to 263. This has meant a reduction in the teaching force through retirement and redeployment and the mothballing of unused classrooms. With the growth of the population in the Droitwich area some catchment area changes have been made so that spare accommodation at the school can be used. The school roll will now rise slowly again.
